Legal_Issue: Whether the Visa Officer erred in failing to formally assess the Applicant as an Advertising/Marketing Consultant under NOC 1122.2
Evidence_Assessment: Applicant lacked a business degree but had relevant experience
Decision_Outcome: Application denied initially by Visa Officer
Burden_of_Proof: On Applicant to demonstrate eligibility for permanent residence
Legal_Rule: Visa officers must conduct a formal assessment if there's a reasonable chance of meeting occupational requirements, even if usual qualifications are absent
Procedural_Issue: Failure to conduct formal assessment based on rigid interpretation of 'usually required' qualifications
Grounds_for_Claim: Erroneous interpretation of NOC requirements by Visa Officer
Outcome_on_Merits: Court found merit in the application; remitted for reassessment
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Visa Officer failed to apply flexible interpretation, leading to procedural unfairness
Key_Evidence_Considered: Applicant’s work experience in advertising/marketing, lack of formal business degree
Applicant_Challenge: Denial of permanent residence due to alleged failure to meet educational requirements
Court_Result: Application allowed; matter remitted to a different visa officer
Defendant_Response: Visa Officer maintained refusal based on absence of required educational credentials
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence of work experience, job descriptions, educational records
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of decision, reassessment of application
Outcome: Judicial review granted, application remitted for reassessment
Remedy_Sought: Reassessment by a different visa officer
Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial review followed by administrative reassessment
Authority: Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada (IRCC), Federal Court
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Failure to meet educational requirements for NOC 1122.2
